properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts around 30 cm is expected by Saturday night. Heavy snow continues to fall as another push of moisture is expected today with an additional 15 cm possible. North of the Columbia Icefield lesser snowfall accumulations are expected today. The snow will taper off this evening. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-22T08:41:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-21T16:42:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2918521949.2019
Area: Highway 93 North - Jasper to Saskatchewan River Crossing
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts approaching 50 cm is possible by Saturday night. Another push of moisture is expected today with 10 to 20 cm possible. This would bring total two day accumulations up to 45 cm by Saturday night. The heaviest snow is expected to fall south of Saskatchewan River Crossing. Somewhat lesser amounts totalling 30 cm are possible from Saskatchewan River Crossing north to the Columbia Icefield area. North of the Columbia Icefield area minimal snowfall accumulations are expected today. ### Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-22T03:31:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-21T11:32:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0463968790.2019
Area: Highway 93 South - Lake Louise to Saskatchewan River Crossing, Highway 93 North - Jasper to Saskatchewan River Crossing
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The coldest wind chill values will be near minus 50. A strong arctic ridge of high pressure across northern Yukon will give temperatures near minus 43C through Sunday. A gentle breeze at times will result in wind chill values reaching minus 50. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-22T05:11:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-21T13:12:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1187408452.2019
Area: Old Crow

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. Areas of dense fog will persist into late this afternoon and early this evening. The fog will dissipate as snow begins to fall this evening. ### Fog advisories are issued when near zero visibilities in fog are expected or occurring. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 60 to 80 cm is expected by Sunday morning. Heavy snow continues to fall as another push of moisture is expected today with an additional 15 to 25 cm possible. The heaviest snow is expected to fall south of Saskatchewan River Crossing to the western edge of the foothills. While total amounts will vary across the region, localized amounts up to 1 m (100 cm) are possible. The snow will taper off Sunday morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Poor weather conditions may contribute to transportation delays. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-22T08:21:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-21T16:22:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1622439078.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A stream of moisture from the Pacific continues to push into southwestern Alberta, and precipitation continues to fall in the Rockies. Near Crowsnest Pass, precipitation is falling as rain, with a snow level near 1600 metres. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm is possible within this snow level in areas near the British Columbia border. Precipitation is expected to continue through today and tonight before the system moves eastward. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-22T09:36:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-21T17:37:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2831593551.2019

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 20 to 30 cm is expected. A strong Pacific frontal system continues to hammer the Columbias with heavy snow. Snow will continue today with snowfall amounts of 5 to 15 cm is expected by this evening. Snow will finally come to an end this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-22T03:47:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-21T11:48:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2180692921.2019
Area: North Columbia, Kinbasket, West Columbia, East Columbia, Yoho Park - Kootenay Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. Heavy rain for the eastern portions of the Elk Valley. A frontal system is currently stalled over southern BC. With a steady stream of moisture and mild temperatures, heavy rain is expected to continue over parts of the Elk Valley through today. Close to 60 mm of rain has been reported near Morrissey. Areas near Fernie and Morissey can expect additional rainfall amounts of 15 to 25 mm today. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-22T03:46:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-12-21T11:56:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0068018533.2019
Area: Elk Valley
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. A frontal system has stalled over southern BC. A steady feed of moisture, streaming into the southern Interior has brought copious amounts of snow to many highway passes. Numerous highway closures are in effect, consider alternate travel plans until conditions improve. Heavy snow will continue this afternoon. Additional snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm are possible by late afternoon. Snow will finally end later this afternoon and this evening. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-12-22T02:04:29-00:00

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Strong west to southwest winds with localized gusts to 90 km/h are expected to weaken late this evening. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
